alert.note: Alert for Northern Erie; Southern Erie (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 24 at 6:39AM EST until December 25 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EST SUNDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST THIS MORNING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO NOON EST SUNDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills occurring. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow occurring. Additional snow accumulations of up to an inch today. Amounts of 3 to 5 inches may occur tonight into Sunday morning, especially near and north of I-86. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph causing blowing and drifting snow. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 10 to 20 below zero. * WHERE...Northern Erie and Southern Erie counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until 10 AM EST this morning. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 4 PM EST Sunday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 10 AM this morning to noon EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A fresh light coating of snow and winds expected to increase slightly through mid morning will continue to cause blowing and drifting snow. Visibilities drop to 1/2 mile to a mile at times, impacting travel along I-90, I-86 and I-79. Locations along the lakeshore should have the strongest wind gusts. Lake effect snow will sink southward toward the lakeshore of Erie County this evening into Sunday morning
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission remind motorists to adjust speeds based on driving conditions as winter weather impacts Pennsylvania roadways. Visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadway, and traffic conditions.
